name: Squats on Multipress
how_to_perform:
# Squats on Multipress
1. Start by standing in front of a multipress machine, with the platform set to the desired height.
2. Place your feet shoulder-width apart and slightly wider than hip-width, facing the machine.
3. Engage your core and take note of the proper stance and setup for optimal performance.

4. Lower yourself down into a squat position, keeping your back straight, chest up, head down, shoulders relaxed, and glutes tight.
5. Lower yourself to the platform height (typically just shorter than knee-level), but not touching it. This would make the movement purely vertical.
6. Stop for 2â€“3 seconds as you touch each platform once at the midline of your thigh muscles on both sides below 90 degrees in range-of-motion motion.
7. Then, push yourself back up to standing position maintaining control over the descent,
8. Repeat with proper posture from 1-50 repetitions (according to training goals and experience) before resting.
short_summary: Squats on a multipress are strength exercises designed to train various lower body muscles via leg movement.
